result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal L. Domka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse programs AFTER 14 months.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Obtain/maintain fulltime employment or schooling or combination of both to the extent she is medically able.
Complete a Psychological assessment, if one is not done in prison, and comply with treatment recommendations.

No contact with Jessica Helminiak.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Get all medications from one (1) pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases of information so the agent can monitor all forms of treatment she is under and medications she is prescribed. 
Provide list of medications to her agent.
Comply with any other assessment, treatment or programming deemed appropriate by the DOC. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Comply with Aftercare program in terms of substance abuse.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: of conviction and order - ERP /s/ TTF 10/25/17
IT IS ORDERED that the extension motion is granted.  The time to file a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is hereby extended to January 14, 2017
for Extension of Time to File Post-Conviction Motion or Notice of Appel - copy

Defendant Crystal L. Domka #516552 appeared by phone. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.

1:35 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Defendant was formally represented by Atty Drengler but Atty Drengler is not present.

Defendant is currently at Taycheedah Correctional.

Defendant wrote a letter to the Court regarding petrial incarceration credit.

Court reviews the file. 

Defendant believes she deserves more days credit, totaling 74 days, not the 34 days that was credited.

Defendant was on probation but had nothing to do with this case, this ended December 10th.

Discussions continue on the record.

Defendant got a bailjumping charge on December 19th, ended up being dismissed and read in. Court reviews this bailjumping case.

Court questions Defendant for clarifications regarding letter written by Defendant.

Parties review PSI.
State won't object to 73 days sentence credit. 

BY THE COURT:
Court will give Defendant 74 days credit - JOC is to be amended to reflect this.
letter from defendant in regards to sentence credit
Sentence adjustment review on October 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Crystal L. Domka in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Crystal L. Domka in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF57, 15CF477

1:32 p.m.  Court calls the cases and states the appearances.  

Court questions if plea was entered on 15CF477.  
Atty Constable makes statements to the Court.  Based on the agreement, moves to dismiss and read-in 15CF477. 
Atty Drengler concurs. 

BY THE COURT:  15CF477 is dismissed but read-in. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI.  
Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  
5 years prison with 2 1/2 years initial confinement followed by 2 1/2 years extended supervision:
No contact with Jessica Helminiak.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Get all medications from one (1) pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases of information so the agent can monitor all forms of treatment she is under and medications she is prescribed. 
Provide list of medications to her agent.
Comply with any other assessment, treatment or programming deemed appropriate by the DOC. 
Complete a Psychological assessment, if one is not done in prison, and comply with treatment recommendations. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Obtain/maintain fulltime employment or schooling or combination of both to the extent she is medically able. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Comply with Aftercare program in terms of substance abuse. 
Eligible for Earned Release and Challenge Incarceration programs AFTER 14 months. 

Parties retain the PSI confidentially in their files. 

Written explanation of determinate sentence is provided to the defendant.
Court advises post-conviction.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

11/6/15 Per Judge Fluguar - Day Report amended from on court dates to 7 times per week. az

Defendant Crystal L. Domka in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Crystal L. Domka in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:45 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a sentencing hearing. 

Court did order a PSI, one was prepared, copies were forwarded to counsel.
Atty Constable received a copy, has no corrections from a factual standpoint. Atty Constable addresses the Court regarding change of circumstance. There are numerous violatons that the State was not aware of, several incidents of illegal drug.  State will either revoke offer and stipulation offer with withdrawing Defendant's pleas or else continue with recommendation but would assert to the Court that it should be relied upon on a limited sense for reasons stated on the record.  Defense is requesting this matter be adjourned for a short period of time and State does not object to adjourning this for a future hearing date.

Atty Drengler concurs.  
Defendant is currently sitting on a revocation case, 120 days. Release date is December 9th.

Atty Drengler requests the matter be set for a status conference.

Atty Constable addresses the Court regarding specific statements in the PSI. 

Matter will be set for a status.

Court requires Defendant to report to day report 7 times per week - to be added to the bond.
  Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 11-06-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Crystal L. Domka in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:50 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Drengler agrees to the repeater statute. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 2 as a repeater.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 
Court orders a PSI. 
PSI to be completed by 10/30 with copies forwarded to counsel to prepare sentencing arguments.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
